website_summaries.verdict: Despite a higher-than-average price, this tenderizer remains popular because it handles large cuts of meat.
pros: Tiny blades easily penetrate meat with minimal pressure
Tenderizes meat in a short amount of time
High performance level and good build quality
cons: Customers say tiny blades could cut your skin, so handle the tool with care at all times

customer_reviews.title: Beware the knock-off Jaccard
customer_reviews.text: I can see by the pictures other buyers have posted that they received genuine Jaccard tenderizers. I did not. What I received was a knock-off of questionable quality. That is what I am giving two stars. I have a Jaccard, they are great, so it's a shame that Amazon is selling this junk as the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: Instead of this white model, buy the black model.  This is why:
customer_reviews.text: To clean this tenderizer was simply a nervous process. (Nevertheless I found out how great the meat tastes from using it.) This model does not disassemble easily. Who wants to unscrew 3 bolts and handle sharp blades? I went to www.jaccard.com and watched the video of another model in black color that is sold on amazon as Jaccard Simply Better Meat Tenderizer Knife 45 Blade Model: 200345NS. The video showed the black model disassembles and reassembles literally in seconds. No screws to mess with. Tonight I placed order to buy two of the black ones. That is the answer to truly easy cleaning meat tenderizer. No more sleepless night for me thinking how to clean a meat tenderizer.
customer_reviews.author: A hiker

customer_reviews.title: quality is not what it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for many years and it finally wore out and was having trouble retracting the blades so I purchased a new one. The first one was worse that my old worn out one. It would hang up and not retract, did not work smoothly at all even after we oiled it as instructed. The return was easy and the replace one seems to work OK, though it still doesn't work as smoothly as the old one did, which is exactly the same model/style. But will keep it because it does make steak so much more tender and with the multiple blades, does it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Did not work right-blades hit bottom guard/guide  plate
customer_reviews.text: I have this same type but with removable cartridge by the same company, and it works really well. But as I have to remove the cartridge to properly clean it, and it's a few years old now, I figured to replace it with this simpler no cartridge model. However, the one I received when compressed to puncture the meat, wants to hit the plastic bottom guard and impede the blade movement. Unusable. Returned it. I'm sticking with the model I have for now I guess.
customer_reviews.author: M. O.

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is unreal. We took a cheap, thick cut London Broil and put this thing to work on it. It was the best steak we have ever made at home and was as tender as a 20-30 dollar piece of meat. An absolute must have for steak lovers!
customer_reviews.author: Nellybelly333

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tenderizer
customer_reviews.text: An excellent tenderizer for steaks or any other meat. A word of caution, the spring action makes it hard to push down which tends to flatten the meat. If I would have suggested any improvements, it would be to make the spring action more gentle. But it works really good for cheaper cuts of steak that need to be tenderized. Also helps using it before marinating to get more of the flavor into the meat. Put in on the top rack of the dishwasher for cleaning to sanitize it for the next time it is used especially since you use it on raw meat.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Buff

customer_reviews.title: Strong spring, sharp "knife" blades.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because the little round tenderizer with a bunch of needles on it didn't do the job. This one is 48 blades and has a strong spring mechanism. I wash it in the upper rack of the dishwasher. I dont take it apart. Meat has gotten much tougher over the last several decades & even a ribeye marinated with a vacuum-sealed container still comes out too tough. This product made a big difference on a pot roast & I'm next going to do a top round for chili, then a ribeye. With meat as mediocre as it is today, you need one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Functions exceptionally well - tenderizes exceptionally well!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this on beef, chicken, even used it to pierce polish sausage that I decided to pickle and spice up. Results are really pleasing and it has become a regular tool in the kitchen arsenal. This thing is super sharp and very well made. We find this is best put in the top rack of the dishwasher... trying to hand wash does not seem to work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Just like the steakhouses use
customer_reviews.text: Worked at Texas Roadhouse for 9 years and they use this exact product on all of their steak, chicken, and pork. The product works great and is really easy to operate. Makes for much faster cooking, more tenderness, and better marinade absorption. You won’t be disappointed. A good pro tip I learned at Roadhouse, use some good food safe oil (olive, vegetable etc) and rub it on the end posts of the device every once in a while to make sure it stays working easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ashtin S.

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on recommendation of brother. So glad I did. Tried it out on some very tough, lean Venison. In the words of family- "best Venison ever- very tender". Then tried it out on some lower quality chicken breasts- the steroid ones where each breast weighs about 2.5lbs. I quit using these because they were so tough. Tried the tenderizer out on these- fantastic. Not tough at all. Will pay for itself in no time because you do not have to purchase the best cut of meat to get a tender meal. Worth 10 stars if available. Best purchase this year.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Neilson

customer_reviews.title: Solid but it isn't the greatest
customer_reviews.text: First time with this brand. Others have broken over time so I tried this one. Teeth don't line up well with guard causing resistance on every depression. It is difficult to clean out in between the teeth especially with chicken because it gets forced up into the tooth guide becoming trapped between the rows of teeth. It seems to be solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Hadn’t heard of a Jaccard until I started eating grass-fed beef. It is fast and easy to use, and it tenderizes the meat amazingly well. I don’t even try to wash it by hand (too sharp). I just throw it in the dishwasher on the top shelf, and it comes out sparkling.
customer_reviews.author: DogMomTo2

customer_reviews.title: I WILL "NEVER" USE A MEAT POUNDER AGAIN!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this new kitchen gadget to pierce through two inch thick chicken breasts. I pierced both sides and all over. The grilled chicken breasts were the BEST I've ever had - they were SO TENDER & JUICY!! This tool saves me a lot of time by eliminating the extra work of having to slice my chicken breasts in half and then pounding them just to make them tender.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Magee

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these since the early 90's I bought at a food show in Chicago for an embarrassing amount of money by the looks of this price. My son wanted one for Christmas, I found it here and was able to get him something else as well. We love these for tenderizing our meat, you can buy cheaper cuts and actually chew them after you use this. Jaccard is the original manufacturer of this as well as the makers of the machines the butcher uses to make "Cube Steak" as they call it in Michigan or "Chicken Fried" in Texas.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Gilliland

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: I like it. One must be careful though, as the tines are razor sharp. It has good protection but the curious should beware. It’s easy enough to clean so far, and is far superior to beating the daylights out of a piece of meat. Marinade penetrates nicely and cheap tough meat becomes a notch more tender. Well, meat hasn’t gotten any cheaper but it has gotten tougher. This gadget offers a path back to the old days of reasonably tender meat. Don’t over do it lest the meat turn into a shredded pile of mush.
customer_reviews.author: fourbyfive

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I unpackaged this product and was so excited to use it since I had had one similar to it for years. Unfortunately the holes are all misaligned on this so the metal prongs don't fit right rendering it completely useless. It was a total waste of over $21. I did not keep the packaging so I'm not sure I can even return it. But need to warn other how shoddy it is. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Julie I.

customer_reviews.title: Important Kitchen Tool
customer_reviews.text: The best meat tenderizing device I have ever owned. Cleaning is better done with a brush but like I said, "The best meat tenderizing device I have ever owned." I have had it for quite a long time now and it is still doing it's thing. I highly recommend the device to anyone who enjoys very tender steaks and chops and other such delicacies.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Changed my flank steak forever!
customer_reviews.text: Changed flank steak for me forever! I love flank steak but just could NOT get it tender no matter how much I beat it, or long I marinated. But not anymore! My flank steak game is stronger than ever. Poke it full holes, marinate for a couple of hours and you’ve got the best steak ever.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Lassini

customer_reviews.title: Any meat eater should have one
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this to me and wow it is great. Honestly this has changed how I marinate and cook food. I bought it to prepare venison but now I use it with all my meats. My mom and mother-in-law were impressed and both had to have one. It makes the meat much more tender and combined with a vacuum marinader it works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great, reliable, consistent brand and product.  I wouldn’t use any other kind.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using one of these at work for years and years. Never broke or discolored. Just run it through the dishwasher and allow to air dry when you are done with it. Love the cover that it comes with. Great, reliable, consistent product and brand. I wouldn’t use any other kind.
customer_reviews.author: leeleemama

customer_reviews.title: A must have for grillers
customer_reviews.text: My husband has used his jacquard for years. Everyone comments on how tender his grilled items are. So, we bought one of these for both of our sons-in-laws for birthday gifts. Highly recommend everyone who wants tender meat get one and use it for all meats before preparing them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing. I was at a nice restaurant and ordered a steak and you could cut it with your finger it was so soft. I asked the waiter how their steaks were so tender and he told me they use one of these. I bought it ASAP. I'm a big meat eater I don't always use it but it's especially good to use on cheaper cuts of steak. It's awesome on chicken too.
customer_reviews.author: ZH

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used this on steak and it worked like a dream. Meat nice and tender. Only used it the once but I think it won't disappoint in the future. Very sharp so keep the kids away from it!!! Not an everyday kind of gadget but a good one when you need it
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as he is a chef and he loved it! He had one before and somebody at work and somebody took it so I wanted to replace it and he was very happy that I did!
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Tenderizer
customer_reviews.text: We've own one of these for going on ten years and it has been great. We use it several times a week. It allows marinades to get better penetration into the meat, as well as making the meat more tender. We recently bought an additional one as a gift for a family member that didn't have one. They also have been very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tenderizer
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product. It tenderized wonderfully. Also the spices I added were more pronounced. I have found it easy to clean. I soak it in hot soapy water, rinse it off and lay it on its side to dry. I read all the negative reviews before I bought it and, so far, have not found them to be true. I suggest if you do have problems with this product, return it and request a new one. It is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: sharalyn landis

customer_reviews.title: Tender tender pork. Yummy
customer_reviews.text: Jaccard makes any cut of meat tender. It is so simple to use. It is easy to clean with a dish brush. I usually do not cook pork unless its pork belly. Pork chops always came out a bit tough. However, the jaccard made the pork chops so tender and it was juicy. Why did not one tell me about this earlier?! Totally recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Essential for grass-fed meats!
customer_reviews.text: Much-needed to tenderize grass-fed meats. The 48 blades work fast to do the job. It does take two hands for me to push down, and while it's dishwasher safe, I pour boiling water over the blades immediately, and use a stiff soapy brush to clean it. There are 3 rows of blades, and the center row is difficult to clean with a brush. Comes with a cover for safe drawer storage.
customer_reviews.author: cschrepp

customer_reviews.title: ... conjunction with our vacuum marinating system and it works wonderfully. It allows ample penetration of the marinate or ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this in conjunction with our vacuum marinating system and it works wonderfully. It allows ample penetration of the marinate or rub, especially when there is a short amount of preparation time allotted. If you use this with a marinade, you can typically get full flavor within a couple of hours, if you use this with a rub, you may want to leave it overnight, or at least 12 hours to let the rub mix with the juices in the meat. We typically run it through the vacuum marinator, then seal it in a freezer bag or vacuum bag right after to let it sit. Typically the thinner the marinade, the faster it sinks in.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony H.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and sharp
customer_reviews.text: I love this product even though it's not very easy to clean. You do have to be careful with it. I love how heavy/sturdy this tool is. I've already used it a few times and can't imagine getting anything different then this.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. It absolutely will make your meats far more tender. We also use it to enhance marinade penetration. If you have a sous vide cooker, use this first for insanely tender meat.
customer_reviews.author: BillHilton

customer_reviews.title: The one and only
customer_reviews.text: Accept no imitations. The cheaper tenderizers made and styled to appeal to hunters just aren't built as well, nor are they as easy to clean and maintain. If you're turning out cube steaks from Costco bottom rounds on a regular basis, you'll thank yourself for buying this instead of saving a few bucks and buying a cheaper, less useful alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Every kitchen needs one!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I went this long without a meat tenderizer! It’s so easy and my steak absorbed the marinade right away. It shortens the cooking time for the meat! I’ll be using this everyday! It’s great that I can throw it in the dishwasher when I’m done Every kitchen needs one.
customer_reviews.author: Angelee Kamats

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works wonders. Very well built. Cleaning by hand can be a bit challenging. Using a water/bleach spray helps. TIP: season your meat before tenderizing. This will get the seasonings deep into the meat before cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pouliot

customer_reviews.title: Wish I invented this
customer_reviews.text: All the anti like comments are totally wrong. This is packed perfectly, even difficult to open...more importantly is some say there is no cover protector on gadget. There is a protector. As far as whether these tenderizer are good for tenderizing that is not the Jaccard fault....buy the correct meat and it should work very well....
customer_reviews.author: Anne Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this product for years. It is good for use on less tender cuts of meat. Meat tenderized with this product holds on to its juice when cooking. I give it four out of five stars on the cleaning aspect only because it cannot easily be cleaned by hand - it should go in a dishwasher. It is well constructed and will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I can use this to soften any steak. In fact I can buy a cheap cut, use this on it, marinate for 24 hours and have a very soft easy to cut and chew steak. Glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Joef96

customer_reviews.title: Great for tenderizing beef...
customer_reviews.text: As a tenderizer of beef, it works just fine. Otherwise, the blades are difficult to hand clean, so I ran the device through a dishwasher cycle which visually appears to provide sufficient cleaning. Also, the blade cover is quite a tight fit and consequently does not snap into place easily for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Lauhon

customer_reviews.title: Best tenderizer around!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product, it works great, I used it for the first time the other night and my meat turned out tender and juicy!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Fuller

customer_reviews.title: makes a difference!
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and makes a difference. don't over-do it. just a little is enough. It'll make a chicken breast taste like ground chicken if you over-do the tenderizing. Just hit a couple of times!!! Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: waynerd

customer_reviews.title: Good for chicken
customer_reviews.text: This will tenderize boneless chicken breasts very well. My family cant figure how I get grilled chicken so tender. Afterwards ... it goes straight into the top rack of the dishwasher. Its stainless steel so no corrosion!
customer_reviews.author: Butter

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have purchased years ago
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He used it on steaks that he grilled. They were honestly the most tender steaks he has ever made. Wish I would have bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I like that it was easy to use. The cover is great at protecting the blades when not in use. Cleans easy, but let it dry really well before putting the cover back on.
customer_reviews.author: Guapoberry

customer_reviews.title: I can't get enough of this!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this meat tenderizer! You can determine exactly how tender you want your meat by the amount of times you use this tenderizer. I cooked dinner for the family and my mother has false teeth and isn't able to chew much, she honestly hasn't had a steak in years! I told her I was going to fix one she could enjoy and she certainly did. It's also so easy to use. You just press down on the handle and the micro blades do the work for you. Such a simple design and easy to clean. I can't get enough of this. I'll be ordering more for presents.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie umali

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY JACCARD!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was catering a party and someone had brought a London broil. After it was cooked, it sliced like butter. I had asked the guy who brought it, how did he get it so tender??? He said he used The Jaccard and then marinated it for like 2 days. He showed me the picture of it on Amazon and the next day I ordered it. It is very sturdy and easy to use. I made steak for my family and they loved it. The meat was so tender. You can use it on chicken, pork or any meat. I just love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Works Super
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended on a BBQ website so I ordered it to try. This is the TOOL for tri-tip. I prepare the meat as usual with mustard and rub then I used this tool. It produces fine slices through the meat and takes the rub along with it. The tri-tip was great. I will not smoke another one without using this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Skypilot 18

customer_reviews.title: I love this. It is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It is very easy to use. I use it for my BBQ. Made of plastic. and the metal poles hold it together. Easy sliding action. The plastic piece at the bottom acts as a tenderizer along with the multiple blades. The blades also cut incisions into the meat, making it easier for the marinade to soak into the meat. Must be careful not to hit any bones because it can dull the blade. Easy to clean. All you need to do is put it in the top rack of your dishwasher and make sure its facing down. Only Con is that you cant take it apart to clean the inside where you hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great!! Best tenderizer I've ever used. If you clean it right away after use ,you shouldn't have a problem. Once food dries on the blades if will be harder to clean. Be very careful when cleaning. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Meat tenderizer
customer_reviews.text: I had never used one of these before I only had a meat clever but now I have both on really thick pieces of steak it works really great and it helps a lot getting my marinade all thru my steak
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A

customer_reviews.title: for smooth operation, flood it with vegetable oil before using
customer_reviews.text: This really tenderizes some of the toughest cuts of steak. My only problem is that it does not operate smoothly, and when the blades fail to move the pressure tends to flatten the meat. i have found that the best way ot use it is to really flood it with Crisco. I have had a much better experience since I have started doing that.
customer_reviews.author: C. David Bridges

customer_reviews.title: No more tough London broil
customer_reviews.text: This works great to tenderize London broil. We use it all the time and bought several more for gifts. We made the mistake of taking it apart to clean. It wasn’t easy to get back together. The knives are sharp so it is not the easiest to clean but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: BBoop

customer_reviews.title: Makes cheaper meats tender, makes all meats absorb marinade like a sponge
customer_reviews.text: I love this Jaccard. I have used it to tenderize Choice steaks in to near prime tenderness. I have used it to tenderize chicken breast, and roasts. It does is great job of tenderizing. but where it really shines is helping the meats take up the marinade very well. After I use this on a roast, I take some butcher string and tie it around the meat to keep it nice and thick. this keeps the juices in and makes cook time more consistent with non jaccarded meats. I have told several friends about it after they tasted my cooking. Each has bought one immediately.
customer_reviews.author: trbizwiz

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this years ago and I remember it been a good tenderizer. After taking it out of its package and testing it out seems to be as good as I remember it
customer_reviews.author: Stamos

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for tenderizing meats!
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is amazing! I can’t imagine cooking meat without it. Makes meats extremely tender. To clean just pop in dishwasher. Have bought for several friends too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Meat Stabber 9000
customer_reviews.text: This meat stabby thing is awesome. Could also double as a weapon but I don't suggest that. Just beat your meat with it and you'll wonder how you ever managed beating your meat without it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Grimord

customer_reviews.title: Concur on 5 Stars - Fun to Use!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on the paleo diet so I eat a lot of steak - some not so tender such as London Broil. This tenderizer makes the meat super tender and allows better absorption of marinades. I actually like using this thing - I find it fun turning my steak into soft beef. Very sharp knives, easy storage, and quality construction - and it is safe to use with a comfortable handle and retractable knives which makes it easy to manipulate too. I just got done punishing my steak as I was preparing it to cook and it reminded me to leave a review. An inexpensive toy to have in your arsenal in the kitchen - highly recommended~!
customer_reviews.author: Cambo

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING ITEM FOR YOUR COOKING/BUTCHER/CULINARY NEEDS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, Great on pork chops, chicken and any other item just use caution super sharp! Restaurant quality. As far as cleaning I would not put in dishwasher so it will last. Never place knives or professional cutlery/items in dishwasher in my opinion as it could be affected with the heat etc. This product is well worth it and tenderizes product breaking down fibers and would super high reccommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: M.J.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is the bomb!
customer_reviews.text: Turns backstrap into super tender meat. Turns london broil into filet mignon (ok not really, but maybe a tender sirloin) Try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, dependable and easy to use. I bored an eye of round and it was perfect tender. Perforate then marinate, cannot beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Dachshund dad

customer_reviews.title: Meat ninja
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super wicked. I don't care how tough of a cut of meat you have, this thing will tenderize it. I read a couple of other reviews that warn you that you can "over tenderize". I have to agree with those reviewers. You can definitely get carried away with this thing. You'll have to experiment with it to find the sweet spot. Meat does cook much faster after using this. If you have perfected your cook time on your favorite 1” thick rib-eye then you will have a new learning curve. Get some beer, steaks, and a stop watch and get to experimenting. Don't hesitate to purchase this, it’s a beast.
customer_reviews.author: Sandblaster

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST!! My "X" had one of these and he cooked the best steaks, better than any restaurant. Season your steak before cooking, use this tenderizer and it infuses the seasoning by piercing the meat forcing the seasoning through and through. It flattens the meat but you just reshape while raw and grill/cook them like you normally would. Some would call it pricey, but I swear....WORTH EVERY DIME!!! Try "Greek Seasoning" on beef/rib-eyes etc., you'll be surprised..it's your favorite steak house's secret ingredient. P.S. this is honestly the first product I have ever rated.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on my man Alton's show and gave it a try. Works great, seems heavy duty. Put through dishwasher a few times with no ill effect.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Might be hard to clean. Have not tried it yet. Its easy to use, priced right....apparently there is a price increase, delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to use and it works great. Depending on what use you it on depends on how easy it is to clean.
customer_reviews.author: John Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Makes tough meat tender!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what is needed today to make tough meat tender. Study product, easy to clean. Gave this to my brother and sister as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: 99nbvette

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: We used to give these little units away to our grassfed beef customers and they work fairly well. A few smacks in a steak won't do much, but given time you can really tenderize the tar out of a beef steak! We finally broke down and bought a Hobart Cuber to run our meat through, mostly because we eat a lot of aged cows and old sows, and our young children get tired of chewing their meat excessively. The cuber is SUPER fast, but a complete pain to clean up, whereas this Jaccarder is quick and easy. It doesn't take up much room in the drawer either - our cuber takes up a whole shelf!
customer_reviews.author: frogholr

customer_reviews.title: Jaccard meat tenderizer
customer_reviews.text: I like how I don't have to beat meat with mallet any more really get the spices into the meat.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores j Scribner

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, but handle wth care
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best tenderizer I've run across - so much so that I bought another one for my mom. Quality is top-notch and functionality is great - it'll make economy cuts of meat super-tender, and marinated meats seem more totally infused. But be careful, although protected with a guard, every single one of those 48 blades is VERY sharp. Beside taking care during use/cleaning, be sure to store it away from curious, young kids. Cleaning initially was a chore, but the easiest thing I've found to do is to simply soak in warm/hot soapy water and then rinse with hot water. Great product - one of few I personally recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: I need a better understanding of how to use it
customer_reviews.text: solid and well made. Does what it is supposed to do. I need a better understanding of how to use it. It does take some getting used to. I am never sure if i have tenderized to much or to little. I also worry that the top part, which doesn't open, isn't clean on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Tenderizes the meat without tearing it up. I've used it on NY Strip and Ribeye steaks. You can definitely tell the difference in tenderness. This product appears to be well made, and the blades are very sharp. Also, the blades are replaceable if they get dull. It also comes with a plastic cover to keep your fingers safe when not in use. It's easy to use, and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: T. Day

customer_reviews.title: Tenderizing
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the 'tines' stick in the meat but I do like it-- It is a little difficult to clean though. Sometime I still use my old hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Ret Leo

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Difference - Love it!
customer_reviews.text: These are the bomb! They make huge difference with many cuts of meat, especially skirt and flank steaks.
customer_reviews.author: COLDESU

customer_reviews.title: how do you put together
customer_reviews.text: I took this apart to clean the device and now I can not put back together, I've had several friends try and it just will not go back together again!
customer_reviews.author: Montijo 2

customer_reviews.title: You don't know what you are missing
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't used one of these, you are missing a great product. I like to marinate meat and this really speeds up the process as well as making about any cut of meat more tender. I especially like it on chicken breasts and thick pork chops, but it is also good on steaks. I can't think of anything I have used it on that wasn't improved. We have another one from the same company that only has two rows of blades. It also works well, but this one is better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best meat tenderizer purchase
customer_reviews.text: It’s by far the best tenderized I’ve purchased. It’s easy to use. A simple press of the tenderize and it pokes the meat so perfect. It made the meat super tender. Would recommend this item for sure
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than you think
customer_reviews.text: I didn't pay attention to the dimensions when ordering. I thought this thing was maybe three inches wide, like one of those stamps you use to endorse the back of your business checks, but nope it's almost six inches. Kind of a big item. Anyway, feels well made, does the job. The motion feels smooth and feels like it's going to hold up. Washing it is a bit awkward and you want to be careful you don't cut yourself, but otherwise it seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy storage and easy use. Tenderized the meat beautifully. I was impressed and wished I had bought it years ago. I clean it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Helkin

customer_reviews.title: Handy and Safe
customer_reviews.text: Great little kitchen tool! I like to do a Chinese roasted pork belly with crispy skin. The Jaccard Supertendermatic is great for SAFELY piercing the skin! Handy for tenderizing other meats as well!
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Dragon

customer_reviews.title: A new favorite kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: Wow this was a great buy!! it’s very well made, easy to use and does an outstanding job. I was given a lot of venison. Many cuts must be tenderize to enjoy the the meat. This does the trick...easily to use. M
customer_reviews.author: Travel Girl

customer_reviews.title: has screw like others posted and comes apart and knives fall out
customer_reviews.text: I received FAKE...... has screw like others posted and comes apart and knives fall out. NOT at all like real thing in use
customer_reviews.author: Expat_USA

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: As soon as this came in the mail went to the store and grabbed a chuck steak to try it out on. Chuck steak can be pretty tough, so figured was a good test for it. passed it about 3 times on each side, seasoned it, then grilled about 9 minutes. Nice and tender! Easy to use, made quick work of the steak. Didn't stick or get hung up. Cleaned it up ASAP so no meat bits would dry on it, didn't seem to be hard to clean. With the price of beef being what it is these days a very good purchase that should pay for itself pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Hal R. Mcwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Must have.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this tenderizer. I can buy tough cuts of meat and make them nice and tender without ruining the texture of the meat.
customer_reviews.author: Singer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on all cuts
customer_reviews.text: This tenderizer works great on any cut of meat. I also use Adolf's meat tenderizer rub and apply it BEFORE using this tenderizer in order to have some of the flavor penetrate the meat. In order to clean the ends of the needles you have to engage the unit to expose them. I've found it easy to clean, I also will fill the cap with warm water & dish detergent and allow the tenderizer to sit and soak for a few minutes after using.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Myers

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product. After quick delivery with good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. After quick delivery with good price, use on all meats before grilling, baking, roasting or steaming. Tenderizes any cut of meat. Easy clean. Would recommend to anyone who loves tender chicken breast, any beef or pork. Amazing useful product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Best Meats.
customer_reviews.text: I do Competition BBQ. Use this on my Chicken before my two step marinate process. Allows the meat to absorb and also tenderizes for that firs judges bite.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K Broderick

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to use. Very hard to puncture the meat
customer_reviews.author: Dimples

customer_reviews.title: Better than the hammer type tenderizer
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier than using the hammer type tenderizer. It makes holes that poke through, allowing the meat to better marinade thouroughly. Just need to be careful because the pokers are super sharp. Easy to clean with a bristle dishwashing brush. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer F. Woelkers

customer_reviews.title: Can't do any better than this
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful. Tired of cleaning the splatters of blood and meat bits from the tile behind your kitchen counter? Throw that tenderizing hammer in the garage tool box and use this superb gadget instead. Never had chicken or beef that was better than this item produces. 30 seconds and you are done. Beef or chicken cooks clean through even on the grill in half the time. Marinade really penetrates well. Note: Instructions say to go over the meat 4 or 5 times. NOT for 4 or 5 minutes! 4 or 5 times takes 30 seconds or less.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: It's real sharp
customer_reviews.text: It work real good I'm very pleased I'd recommend this to any one .
customer_reviews.author: Reumrocks

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have this product for years now. It's great on any meat, pork or chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tenderizer
customer_reviews.text: Great for less marbled meats or making cube steak. Terrific for marinating poultry. Heavy duty and smooth. Easy to wash. And the cover stays on I. The drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Better than I anticipated!
customer_reviews.text: One of the things holding me back from buying this was the concern that it would be difficult to clean. In reality, it's easy. The meat particles rinse right out and then into the dishwasher to sanitize it. As for the tenderizing action, it's great, really makes a big difference when buying the tougher cuts. Even a few taps on chicken fillets makes them fork tender and it seems like the seasoning penetrates deeper into the meat if you don't have time for a lengthy marinade.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Eggo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son for Christmas. I have owned this same brand for over 10 years and it is still as great as when I first got it. It is easy to use although I am only giving it a 4 star because sometimes it is hard to get it clean, but I find this minor in regards to the great job it does tenderizing, My son actually requested this for Christmas because he likes it so much and has one that is a cheaper model that does not work as well.
customer_reviews.author: scooter

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen accessory
customer_reviews.text: This tenderizer is easy to use and cleans up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Hyman

customer_reviews.title: Favorite new tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite tool I the kitchen. I have used it on chicken breast that in the past I would have brined for tenderness. This does the job lickety split!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: Puncture your meat.
customer_reviews.text: Does a wonderful job. Far better that a mallet tenderizer.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: What a difference this makes to steak!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on less expensive cuts of beef, fry them up in my cast iron skillet, and you'd think you were at a steak house. Love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: KMHS

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money - impossible to clean
customer_reviews.text: Almost impossible to reassemble when you take it apart for cleaning. I would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Broomist

customer_reviews.title: Jaccard Supertendermatic 48-Blade Tenderizer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 48 blade tenderizer and am very pleased with it. I've used it several times. It is easy to use and tenderizes meat like is advertised. The higher priced Jacquard with 48 blades is well worth the extra money: having more blades makes using it much faster and easier. The method of piercing the meat instead of pounding it is, in my opinion, does a much better job of tenderizing.I highly recommend this product. It is well made, durable and will last me a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: SCW gal

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product and my husband has had one for years
customer_reviews.text: This product is suppose to have a life time guarantee but when I contacted them about a screw that came out and was lost they never responded. It was still usable but you had to hold it improperly to work. Now it has lost yet another screw. It is a great product and my husband has had one for years. This one was purchased for my son and he also tried to contact Jaccard. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Donna P

product_meta.title: Jaccard 48-Blade Meat Tenderizer, Original Super 3 Meat Tenderizer, 1.50 x 4.00 x 5.75 Inches, White
product_meta.description: Package Quantity:1| Color:WhiteThe original hand held super meat tenderizer, the #1 choice of professional chefs and home cooking enthusiasts does more than just tenderize is ideal for enhancing any meat including but not limited to beef, pork, veal, chicken, venison and fowl
feature_bullets: Original Hand Held Meat Tenderizer: Reduces cooking time by up to 40% and provides pathway for marinades to be absorbed deeper into the meat and increasing absorption by up to 600%. It is ideal for both professional chefs and home cooking enthusiasts.
Commercial Meat Tenderizer: The meat tenderizer has double sided razor-sharp stainless-steel knives that effortlessly cut through the connective tissue in meat that can cause it to be tough.
Steak Tenderizer, Meat Tenderizer: Achieve better cooking results from less expensive cuts of meat with the original multi-blade hand-held meat tenderizer.

48 Blade Meat Tenderizer: Enhances any type of meat, including but not limited to beef, pork, veal, chicken, venison and fowl; Incredible results on boneless chicken breasts including even cooking, retention of meats natural juices and flavors.

Jaccard Original Meat Tenderizer: The tenderizer is made from the highest quality materials and is built for performance and durability and is backed by a lifetime warranty against material and workmanship defects.
Achieve better cooking results from less expensive cuts of meat with the multi-blade hand-held meat tenderizer
Helps reduce cooking time by up to 40 percent; helps meats cook more evenly by reducing shrinkage
Razor sharp knife blades cut through connective tissues that make meat tough
Tiny heat channels are created without changing shape or appearance of meat, resulting in faster penetration of marinades
Made of white ABS plastic, the tool measures 5-5/8 by 4-1/8 inches
